alert.note: Alert for La Plata (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 28 at 5:10PM MST until December 28 at 6:15PM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: The National Weather Service in Grand Junction has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... East central La Plata County in southwestern Colorado... * Until 615 PM MST. * At 510 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Durango to 8 miles west of Ignacio, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts greater than 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 160 in Colorado between mile markers 90 and 102. Colorado 172 between mile markers 21 and 24. Locations impacted include... Bayfield and Falfa. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents.
